intro: Amerosedum divergens, commonly known as the divergent sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often found in desert and semi-desert environments.
